instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message:
Beer bramaged.  Found and fixed the S5 (clap, clap, clap); missing S4.  Been in circles for days & days.  Need pointing finger.
Have: PPVRTC_G3H & PP3V3_SUS.  Think I'm stuck around U1900 & Crystal?

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: First double check if 5V_S4 is pulsing or coming high for just a fraction. If there is absolutely nothing at all I would first look around the RTC circuit R1300-1303 and for 32KHZ from U1900 pin 12.

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message:
Duke. Awesome. Nice to meet you. I only have a piece of shit analog oscilloscope. I was seeing Louis's video on 1/4 spin earlier, LOL. The R1300's and whole region are good (visually) and get 3.3V. I'm getting 2 paralel lines on the oscilloscope and they look like they are moving pretty fast (like the curve of a lowercase f). Think I need a digital one? I can order one right now. & dead on 5V_S4.

& I am going to look into what these areas are about too.  Thank you for some direction : )

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: Just use a multimeter, even a $5 one will show at least something. Checked for a short on the 5V bus?

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: Measure voltage on R1300-R1303 should be about 3.3V on both sides of all resistors, I guess the oscilloscope can read 32Khz from U1900, this is the clock signal for PCH, without it nothing will work....

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message:
No shorts on 5V's. And 3.3 on all 4 resistors. Thanks for the tidbit on clock on PCH (good place to check 1st , or know about, thank you).
I take that back... 
R1301-2 is 3.0
R1302-2 is 3.2

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message:
No Title

How do I delete this comment?  LOL

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: 4.8v is at C7524 & 12v Q7520 pin 1. Q7520 good?

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: Test point 209 is 3.0V.  That suppose to be 3.3?

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: What if it wasn't 32Khz (for example) & something less or more or not at all would mean U1900, crystal, etc bad?

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: It must be 32 Khz, test point 209 is ok, check  U1900 maybe something corroded on this area......... where originally was the damage?

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message:
Wow. You guys are dedicated to assisting. Thank you. & thank you for some direction. I'll order my digital oscilloscope bc it seems important. Thought this analog would be good enough. & I'll look closer to what you guys are pointing at and report back : )
Not trying to have you guys fix it, I gotta do my part too. Don't want to waste your time.
Thank you.

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: You don't need a digital scope any 1960 crap scope is good enough to measure RTC. Voltages you do with a multimeter. Fancy tools are not going to magically fix these boards.

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: Yes, there is some corrosion in that area.  I used a cap from an iPhone and something else off a 1278 (have lots of 1278's to pull from but thats it, visiting a local recycler for dead Mac boards).  But I think this is the problem.

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message:
My assumptions that I am at least seeing something on the 1960's silly scope is good enough to assume its functioning properly being more practical is a good one.  
Thank you.  I think the area I did work on around the U1900 is not good enough.  I'm going to recheck it. U1845 looks bad around there.  I'm waiting on an appointment at local recycler to find a donor board, don't trust whats online bc they look pretty janky.  Thanks.  I'll follow up with my results.

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: How can you tell if the PCH is bad?

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message:
So I went gorillas and changed every single thing that even looked bad on the entire board.  Same thing. The clock signal looks good, it looks like Louis's on his video (analog though).
Good rails: PP5V_S5, PPRTC_G3H, PP3V3_SUS, PP3V3_S5, PP1V05_SUS.
No S4's...

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: I notice R5233 is missing.  But it looks like it is originally NO_STUFF. Donor has empty too.  But the schematic shows a resister there.  Should I put it?  Or would that throw it into one of those modes? LOL.

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: How come I don't get anything on U7501 pin 2 on a good working board? Am I doing something wrong? I'm seeing the same shit on a working board. Am I suppose to short this thing on before I test?  Probably why I can't fix shit?

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: Plus I get no fan spin or nothing on this good board too.  WTF !?  Is this 45W MagSafe the fucking problem???

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: But I can use this same fucking plug and it will work when fully assembled.  But now that it is broke down and comparing measurements from this good board it's giving me the same shit.

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: You have to use at least a 60W charger. You can use 45W but only when battery is connected.

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: use an 85w adapter for everything. it is worth buying this from apple.com just to ensure you're troubleshooting with something that will work

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: Ooooohhhhhh......   Thank you !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   I never knew this !!!!!!!!!!!!    Probably why i've never fixed a board to date... Lol !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: Yes sir.... Thank you !!!!

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: Yes, to have one that works on everything, you should get an 85W MagSafe 1 and a MagSafe 2 converter for the newer boards

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message:
Yes!!!!!!!!!!!! Got 5v on pin 2 now !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   Hahahahahahahahaha
thank you !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Sold her a new one for $399. Sad shit. Shit should be illegal. People should class-action their ass. $3 would of fixed it.

threads.message:
So then U0500 got a little warm now.  Got S4's, S3's & no S0's.  Will investigate.  Been stuck FOREVER on the S4.

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: The CPU can't get warm with no S0. Something funny is happening here.

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: No Title

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: Does this mean I fixed it?

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message:
CPU hotter than fish grease. This means its going to die?
Do I have to replace it?

Based on some more videos I'm watching (learning as I go), it is possible that something else is possibly causing the CPU to get hot?
I'll see if I can find out and maybe rewash this mug.  But it is turning on & working : )   
(small victory)

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message:
Think its just me.  You need to short it on in order to get the S0's running correct?  Think I wasn't doing that before.
I was doing the monkey see monkey do on the U1950 (I think it was), but undid it.

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message: All macbooks cook, it's why they die all the time. What temps are you getting at idle, vs let's say watching a YT video?

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message:
I don't know about temps.  I only have the bare board plugged in and it is super duper fucking piping molten lava hot.  When I had hooked-up to test if it worked the rest of the computer is fucked off (keyboard, battery, mouse, etc. The other 1502 I have is different and don't look like it belongs LOL, so no clue on the YT test & idle).  Or, do you think its OK? LOL!  Going through your videos for insight hu,hu.
I'mna try to find out about those temps.

threads.title: A1502 820-3476 No S4 - I'm lost
threads.message:
Got a "Go Directly To Jail" card. Nothing on the screen now and I got temps of 140 with no battery and 184 with the battery after about 1 min.

(Actually, I think the drive was bad. With no drive I'm getting the question mark folder. I think there is no back light, I'mna try to fix dat ; )

So it may be ok with temps like that? Throw on some ArticSilver and call it a day?

All & all I'm surprised to have made it this far. (clap)(clap)(clap)(clap)
